Description: Light blue glazed composition amulet in the form of a Nephthys, striding with arms by sides, wearing long garment, with hieroglyph for Nephthys on head, dorsal pillar pierced for suspension at waist, and rectangular base.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 93
Exhibition history: Exhibited: The British Museum/National Geographic: Treasures of the Earth. 2002, St Albans, Life and Death 2011 11 June- Present, 3 year renewable, Indianapolis, The Children’s Museum of Indianapolis, Treasures of the Earth
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
